SENT.plain: The authors treated a girl with severe aplastic anemia that developed following urinary tract infection
She was referred to our hospital for bone marrow transplantation
The detailed medical history of the patient revealed iatrogenic metamizole sodium overdose that was given during her infection
She responded to a 3-day, high-dose methylprednisolone therapy and consequent conventional dose steroid
The authors observed at first partial and subsequently complete remission of all the hematologic parameters of the patient within 30 days and 4 months, respectively
This case suggests that the history of drug use should be questioned carefully in the patients with aplastic features
Steroid treatment may be an appropriate alternative therapy for aplastic anemia if associated drug use is detected in the medical history
